item.title: North Korea could now almost certainly strike London or Berlin. Why isn’t Europe more worried?
item.dc:creator: Rick Noack
item.description: BERLIN — When North Korea tested a new kind of intercontinental ballistic missile on Wednesday, Pyongyang boasted that the regime could now strike “anywhere in the mainland United States.” Experts have calculated that the missile could theoretically reach Washington D.C. which is about 6,700 miles away from North Korea. Less noticed, however, is the fact that North Korea’s recent tests have also […]

item.title: Meghan Markle’s U.S. citizenship could cause tax headaches for British royal family
item.dc:creator: Adam Taylor
item.description: It may seem like a modern fairy tale, but the upcoming wedding of Britain's Prince Harry to American actress Meghan Markle will come with some mundane hurdles. Perhaps most inconveniently for the British royals, this transatlantic partnership could end up involving the United States' Internal Revenue Service. Buckingham Palace announced Tuesday that Markle will become a […]

item.title: A ‘slave auction’ puts the global spotlight back on Libya
item.dc:creator: Ishaan Tharoor
item.description: Want smart analysis of the most important news in your inbox every weekday along with other global reads, interesting ideas and opinions to know? Sign up for the Today's WorldView newsletter. Earlier this month, CNN published cellphone and hidden-camera footage from what appeared to be “slave auctions” conducted in Libya. The images, including video obtained by undercover […]

item.title: North Korea’s latest missile launch suggests weapons testing lull was seasonal, rather than strategic
item.dc:creator: Adam Taylor
item.description: North Korea's latest missile launch is its 20th in 2017 — and it seems to dash the idea that Pyongyang's lull in weapons testing over the past two months indicated a willingness to negotiate. There had been 74 days between Tuesday's test and the last North Korean provocation, a missile launch on Sept. 15 that capped […]

item.title: Prince Harry and Meghan Markle pick a place and a date: Windsor Castle in May
item.dc:creator: Karla Adam
item.description: LONDON — Britain’s Prince Harry and his American fiancee, Meghan Markle, will marry at Windsor Castle in May, palace officials said Tuesday. A day after Harry, 33, and Markle, 36, announced their engagement, palace officials have started to stoke the media engines. The wedding will take place in St George's Chapel, palace officials said in a […]

item.title: Pope Francis avoids the term Rohingya in Burma speech following meeting with Aung San Suu Kyi
item.dc:creator: Rick Noack
item.description: Perhaps as important as what Pope Francis said during his speech in Burma on Tuesday was what he didn't say. Speculation had circled around the question of whether the pope would use the term “Rohingya” to describe the country’s Muslim minority that has been the target of a brutal military “clearance operation.” Rohingya Muslims are not officially recognized as a minority in Burma — […]

item.title: Forty years after it was built, Montreal’s Olympic Stadium is about to get another taxpayer bailout
item.dc:creator: Alan Freeman
item.description: OTTAWA — Olympic Games facilities cost billions to build and get intense use for a few weeks. But then authorities can’t figure out what to do with them. It has been just over a year since the 2016 Summer Games in Rio de Janeiro, and many of that city’s sports complexes are already derelict or desperately […]

item.title: Trump is getting the zero-sum game he wants in the Middle East
item.dc:creator: Ishaan Tharoor
item.description: Want smart analysis of the most important news in your inbox every weekday along with other global reads, interesting ideas and opinions to know? Sign up for the Today's WorldView newsletter. When President Trump entered the White House, he was emphatic about the state of the world around him: “I inherited a mess at home […]

item.title: A ‘ghost ship’ washed ashore in Japan, and clues point to North Koreans
item.dc:creator: Cleve R. Wootson Jr.
item.description: The bodies had been drifting in the Sea of Japan for so long that only bones remained. But investigators in face masks and coveralls found clues inside the battered wooden craft that pointed to a possible origin: an empty cigarette pack of a brand popular in North Korea and unused life jackets with Korean lettering. It’s unclear […]

item.title: Mexico is a democracy, but the ghosts of one-party rule live on
item.dc:creator: David Agren
item.description: MEXICO CITY — When José Antonio Meade, Mexico’s finance secretary, tendered his resignation Monday morning, there was plenty of praise from President Enrique Peña Nieto — but no mention of why Meade was leaving or where he was going. Many Mexicans, however, thought they know exactly what was coming next. Meade's resignation seemed eerily similar […]
